dataProducts.productDescription: Two-dimensional wind speed and direction, available as two- and thirty-minute aggregations of 1 Hz observations.  Observations are made by 2-D sonic anemometer sensors located at multiple heights on the tower infrastructure and by 2-D sonic anemometer sensors located on the aquatic meteorological station.

Air temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations. Observations are made by sensors located at multiple heights on the tower infrastructure and by sensors located on the aquatic meteorological station. Temperature observations are made using platinum resistance thermometers, which are housed in a fan aspirated shield to reduce radiative bias.

Air temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages derived from triplicate 1 Hz temperature observations. Observations are made by sensors located at the top of the tower infrastructure. Temperature observations are made by three platinum resistance thermometers, which are housed together in a fan aspirated shield to reduce radiative biases.

Barometric pressure is available as one- and thirty-minute averages for station pressure, which is determined from 0.1 Hz observations. Barometric pressure corrected to sea level and surface level (defined as water surface at aquatic sites and soil surface at terrestrial sites) is derived from station pressure averages and available at one- and thirty-minute increments. Observations are made by a single digital barometer located on the tower infrastructure and a single digital barometer located on the aquatic meteorological station.

Infrared temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  Biological temperature (i.e. surface temperature) is measured via IR temperature sensors located in the soil array and at multiple heights on the tower infrastructure.

Bulk precipitation collected using up to three methods - primary, secondary, and throughfall. Bulk precipitation is determined at five- and thirty-minute intervals for primary precipitation and at one- and thirty-minute intervals for secondary and throughfall precipitation.

Total dissolved chemical ion concentrations of sulfate (SO4 2-), nitrate (NO3-), chloride (Cl-), bromide (Br-), ammonium (NH4+), phosphate (PO4 3-), calcium (Ca2+), magnesium (Mg2+), potassium (K+), sodium (Na+), and pH/Conductivity in precipitation water; collected at TIS and AIS sites.

Total, direct beam, and diffuse shortwave radiation, available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  Observations are made by a sensor located at the top of the tower infrastructure.
Near real-time measurements of PM1.0, PM2.5, PM4, PM10, PM15 and TSP in the atmosphere using a optical sensor.

Total shortwave radiation, available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  The primary pyranometer is housed in a heated and aspirated ventilation unit and observes incoming shortwave radiation at the top of the tower infrastructure.

Net radiation is composed of incoming and outgoing shortwave and longwave radiation. These data products are available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  Observations of net shortwave and longwave radiation are made by a sensor located at the top of the tower infrastructure, while only net longwave radiation is observed in the soil array.  Observations of net shortwave and longwave radiation are made by a four-component sensor located on the aquatic meteorological station.

Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) observations represent the radiation flux at wavelengths between 400-700 nm, which constitute the wavelengths that drive photosynthesis. This data product is available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  Observations are made by sensors located at multiple heights on the tower infrastructure and by sensors located on the aquatic meteorological station.
Stable isotope ratios of 18O and 2H in precipitation water
The amount of thermal energy moving by conduction across an area of soil in a unit of time. Measured at three of the five sensor-based soil plots at each terrestrial site..

Temperature of the soil at various depth below the soil surface from 2 cm up to 200 cm at non-permafrost sites (up to 300 cm at Alaskan sites). Data are from all five Instrumented Soil Plots per site and presented as 1-minute and 30-minute averages.

The quantum line sensor provides spatially averaged observations of photosynthetically active radiation (PAR), i.e., wavelengths between 400-700 nm, at the soil surface over a one meter length. This data product is available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  Observations are obtained by sensors located throughout the soil array.

dataProducts.productName: Soil water content and water salinity
dataProducts.productDescription:
Soil volumetric water content and an index of salinity at various depths below the soil surface from 6 cm down to 200 cm at non-permafrost sites (down to 300 cm at Alaskan sites). Data are from all five Instrumented soil plots per site and presented as 1-minute and 30-minute averages.

Measurement depths are not currently being reported correctly in the sensor positions file in the Soil water content and water salinity data product (DP1.00094.001). A readme file (readme_swc_depths.txt) and an associated file containing the sensor installation depths (swc_depthsV2.csv) have been added to the data product download package until the data product algorithms are corrected.

CO2 concentration in soil air at various depth below the soil surface starting at approximately 2 cm. Data are from all five Instrumented Soil Plots per site and presented as 1-minute and 30-minute averages.

dataProducts.productName: Soil physical and chemical properties, Megapit
dataProducts.productDescription: Soil taxonomy, horizon names, horizon depths, soil bulk density, texture, and chemical properties in the <= 2 mm soil fraction for each soil horizon in each Megapit. Data were derived from a sampling location expected to be representative of the area where the Instrumented Soil Plots are located and were collected once during site construction, in collaboration with the USDA Natural Resources Conservation Service. Also see distributed soil (DP1.10086.001) and initial characterization soil (DP1.10047.001) data products, as well as the root Megapit product (DP1.10066.001) for root biomass and chemistry measurements.

Relative humidity, temperature, and dew or frost point temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations. Observations are made by sensors located at the top of the tower infrastructure, in the soil array, and on the aquatic meteorologic station.
Dust mass and density measured by a high volume dust sampler and quartz filters.
Count, distance from observer, and taxonomic identification of breeding landbirds observed during point counts
Tally and raw measurement of coarse downed wood >= 2 cm diameter

dataProducts.productName: Coarse downed wood bulk density sampling
dataProducts.productDescription: Raw bulk density measurements of coarse downed wood >= 2 cm diameter

dataProducts.productName: Digital hemispheric photos of plot vegetation
dataProducts.productDescription: Upward and/or downward facing digital 180-degree images of vegetation in plots used to calculate leaf area index
COI DNA sequences from select ground beetles

dataProducts.productName: Ground beetles sampled from pitfall traps
dataProducts.productDescription: Taxonomically identified ground beetles and the plots and times from which they were collected.
Dry weight of herbaceous vegetation harvested from individual clip strips, by functional type
Traits of sun-lit canopy plants reported at the level of the individual (woody plants) or community (herbaceous plants).

dataProducts.productName: Litterfall and fine woody debris production and chemistry
dataProducts.productDescription: Dry weight of litterfall and fine woody debris collected from elevated and ground traps, sorted to functional group, as well as periodic measurements of litter chemistry and stable isotopes.
COI DNA sequences from select mosquitoes
Presence/absence of a pathogen in a single mosquito sample (pool)
Taxonomically identified mosquitoes and the plots and times from which they were collected
Field measurements of individual non-herbaceous perennial plants (e.g. cacti, ferns)

dataProducts.productName: Soil physical and chemical properties, distributed initial characterization
dataProducts.productDescription: Soil physical and chemical properties measured as part of initial site characterization activities at NEON sites. Data are reported by pedogenic horizon, generally for the top 1m of the soil profile. Also see distributed periodic and Megapit soil data.
Phenophase status and intensity of tagged plants

Plant species cover-abundance and presence observed in multi-scale plots. Plant species and associated percent cover in 1m2 subplots and plant species presence in 10m2 and 100m2 subplots are reported from 400m2 plots. Archived plant vouchers and foliar tissue support the data and additional analyses.

Presence/absence of hantavirus (or antibodies to hantavirus) in each single rodent sample from 2014-2019. Beginning in 2020, the protocol was switched to detection of tick-borne diseases; these data are available in the Rodent pathogen status, tick-borne data product (DP1.10064.002).

Standing stock of fine and coarse root biomass plus root carbon (C) and nitrogen (N) concentrations and stable isotopes from soil Megapits. Samples were collected in 10cm increments for the first 1m depth and 20cm increments thereafter to 2m depth. Ground, oven-dried root tissues from each depth increment are available for request from the NEON Biorepository. See the soil Megapit data product (DP1.00096.001) for physical and chemical data from Megapit soils.
Fine root biomass to 30cm depth via soil core sampling. Includes root carbon (C) and nitrogen (N) concentrations and stable isotopes.
Individual- and trap-level data collected using box traps designed to capture small mammals
COI DNA sequences from select small mammals
Counts and relative abundances of archaeal, bacterial, and fungal taxa observed in soil microbial communities

dataProducts.productName: Soil physical and chemical properties, periodic
dataProducts.productDescription: Soil physical and chemical properties from the top 30 cm of the profile from periodic soil core collections. Data are reported by horizon (mineral vs. organic). See initial characterization and megapit products for additional soil data.
Presence/absence of a pathogen in each single tick sample
Abundance and density of ticks collected by drag and/or flag sampling (by species and/or lifestage)

Structure measurements of individual woody and non-woody plants, mapped positions of qualifying woody and non-woody plants, and metadata required to draw inference from individual measurements at the plot scale.
Quantitative abundance of microbes in soil samples
Metagenomic sequence data from soil samples
DNA sequence data from ribosomal RNA marker genes from soil samples
Counts and relative abundances of marker genes from total archaea, bacteria, and fungi observed by qPCR in soil microbial communities
This data product contains records of land management activities, disturbances, and other incidents of ecological note within all NEON sites

Barometric pressure, available as one-minute instantaneous measurements and thirty-minute averages for both station pressure and pressure reduced to sea level. Observations are made on the meteorology station on the buoy in lakes and rivers.
In situ sensor-based measurements of specific conductance of groundwater in wells
In situ sensor-based measurements of surface water elevation, available as five- and thirty-minute  averages in lakes, rivers, and wadeable streams. Based on sensor measurements of water pressure.

dataProducts.productName: Shortwave and longwave radiation above water on-buoy (net radiometer)
dataProducts.productDescription: Net shortwave and longwave radiation on buoys is measured twice per minute and is reported as 1-minute and 30-minute mean values.
In situ sensor-based nitrate concentration, available as fifteen minute  averages in surface water in lakes, wadeable and non-wadeable streams

dataProducts.productName: Photosynthetically active radiation at water surface
dataProducts.productDescription: Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) observations represent the radiation flux at wavelengths between 400-700 nm, which constitute the wavelengths that drive photosynthesis. This data product is available as one-, five-,  and thirty-minute averages. Observations are made at the aquatic sensor set location at lakes, non-wadeable streams, and wadeable streams.
Air temperature, available as one-minute instantaneous measurements and thirty-minute averages. Observations are made on the meteorology station on the buoy in lakes and rivers.
Discharge measurements from field-based surveys
Surface water temperature, available as one-, five-, and thirty-minute  averages, measured by a platinum resistance thermometer at the sensor location in lakes, wadeable and non-wadeable streams
Carbon (C) and nitrogen (N) concentrations of aquatic plant and bryophytes from benthic collections in lakes, rivers, and wadeable streams

dataProducts.productName: Aquatic plant bryophyte macroalgae clip harvest
dataProducts.productDescription: Dry weight of aquatic plant, bryophyte, and macroalgae from benthic quadrats in lakes, rivers, and wadeable streams

dataProducts.productName: Aquatic plant, bryophyte, lichen, and macroalgae point counts in wadeable streams
dataProducts.productDescription: Point counts of aquatic plants, bryophytes, lichens, and macroalgae from transects in wadeable streams
Counts and relative abundances of archaeal, bacterial, and fungal taxa observed in benthic microbial communities from wadeable streams
Grab samples of groundwater chemistry including general chemistry, anions, cations, and nutrients.
Grab samples of surface water chemistry including general chemistry, anions, cations, and nutrients.
Grab samples of surface water dissolved gases including carbon dioxide, methane, and nitrous oxide

dataProducts.productName: Groundwater and active layer measurements at permafrost sites
dataProducts.productDescription: Measurements from ground surface to liquid groundwater and active layer thaw. Collected at sites with permafrost.
Sensor based measurement of groundwater elevation calculated from pressure transducer readings in each well
COI DNA sequences from select fish in lakes and wadeable streams

dataProducts.productName: Fish electrofishing, gill netting, and fyke netting counts
dataProducts.productDescription: Counts of fish from electrofishing surveys in wadeable streams, or electrofishing, gill netting, and/or fyke netting surveys in lakes. Includes fish standard length and individual mass
Collection of benthic macroinvertebrates using multiple sampling methods in lakes, rivers, and wadeable streams
CO1 DNA sequences of the aquatic macroinvertebrate community
Counts and relative abundances of archaeal, bacterial, and fungal taxa observed in surface water microbial communities in lakes, rivers and streams

dataProducts.productName: Periphyton, seston, and phytoplankton chemical properties
dataProducts.productDescription: Carbon (C), nitrogen (N), phosphorus (P), isotopes, chlorophyll a, and pheophytin of periphyton and phytoplankton from benthic and water column samples in lakes, rivers, and wadeable streams
Collection and biomass of periphyton and phytoplankton using multiple benthic and water column sampling methods in lakes, rivers, and wadeable streams

Field and external laboratory data from the salt-tracer and gas injection field reaeration measurements, including stream widths, inert gas concentrations, conservative tracer concentrations, and conductivity times series.
Assessment of riparian vegetation percent cover in wadeable streams
Discharge measured using a constant-rate addition salt tracer during reaeration measurements
Field collection and analysis of nutrients, carbon, inorganics and physical properties in sediments of wadeable streams, rivers, and lakes
Field collection and analysis of size and texture of sediments in wadeable streams, rivers, and lakes
Grab samples for stable isotope chemistry including water and particulate organic matter, in lakes, rivers, and wadeable streams
In situ sensor-based measurements of groundwater temperature in each well.
Collection of zooplankton from water column samples in lakes
CO1 DNA sequences of the zooplankton community
Measurement of water column Secchi depth in non-wadeable streams and lakes
Measurements of water column temperature and depth profile in non-wadeable streams and lakes

dataProducts.productName: Photosynthetically active radiation below water surface
dataProducts.productDescription: Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) observations represent the radiation flux at wavelengths between 400-700 nm, which constitute the wavelengths that drive photosynthesis. This data product is available as one- and thirty-minute averages. Observations are made at the aquatic sensor sets at the lake inlet, lake outlet, and both lake and river buoys.

dataProducts.productName: Temperature at specific depth in surface water
dataProducts.productDescription: Sensor based measurements of water temperature in lake and river sites. Temperature is measured at specific depths by a fixed-length buoy-mounted array of temperature sensors.
Gauge height, in meters, measured at lakes, wadeable streams and non-wadeable streams.
Relative humidity, temperature, and dew or frost point temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages. Observations are made by sensors located on the buoy in lakes and rivers.
Assessment of riparian vegetation composition and physical structure in lakes, non-wadeable streams, and wadeable streams
Grab samples for stable isotopes of water in groundwater
Counts and relative abundances of marker genes from total archaea, bacteria, and fungi observed by qPCR in benthic microbial communities
Counts and relative abundances of marker genes from total archaea, bacteria, and fungi observed by qPCR in surface water microbial communities
Metagenomic sequence data from benthic samples
DNA sequence data from ribosomal RNA marker genes from benthic samples
Metagenomic sequence data from surface water samples

dataProducts.productName: Surface water microbe marker gene sequences
dataProducts.productDescription: DNA sequence data from ribosomal RNA marker genes from surface water samples

In situ sensor-based specific conductivity, concentration of chlorophyll a, dissolved oxygen content, fDOM concentration, pH, and turbidity, available as one- or five-minute instantaneous measurements in surface water of lakes, wadeable streams, and non-wadeable streams.
Reflectance of collected sample(s) using leaf clip and hand-held field Spectrometer; opportunistic product, provided when collected.

Present summary statistics for biometeorological variables for NEON weather stations at core TIS sites. Statistics will include means, standard deviations, maxima, and minima for periods of days, months, and years. Engineering-grade product only.
Map showing the morphology of streams. These maps denote topography of the stream basin as well as location of the thalweg, coarse woody debris, gravel/sand bars, and other features of interest.

Bathymetry of lake bottoms and non-wadeable streams for detecting environmental change as well as for determining lake morphology, estimating primary productivity, habitat features, and water quality.
Bundle of eddy-covariance data products, including related meteorological and soil data products.

Observations are made by 2-D sonic anemometer sensors located at multiple heights on the tower infrastructure and by 2-D sonic anemometer sensors located on the aquatic meteorological station.

Observations of net shortwave and longwave radiation are made by a sensor located at the top of the tower infrastructure, while only net longwave radiation is observed in the soil array. Measurements of water column temperature and depth profile in non-wadeable streams and lakes

dataProducts.productName: Photosynthetically active radiation below water surface
dataProducts.productDescription: Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) observations represent the radiation flux at wavelengths between 400-700 nm, which constitute the wavelengths that drive photosynthesis. This data product is available as one- and thirty-minute averages. Observations are made at the aquatic sensor sets at the lake inlet, lake outlet, and both lake and river buoys.

dataProducts.productName: Temperature at specific depth in surface water
dataProducts.productDescription: Sensor based measurements of water temperature in lake and river sites. Temperature is measured at specific depths by a fixed-length buoy-mounted array of temperature sensors.
Gauge height, in meters, measured at lakes, wadeable streams and non-wadeable streams.
Relative humidity, temperature, and dew or frost point temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages. Observations are made by sensors located on the buoy in lakes and rivers.
Assessment of riparian vegetation composition and physical structure in lakes, non-wadeable streams, and wadeable streams
Grab samples for stable isotopes of water in groundwater
Counts and relative abundances of marker genes from total archaea, bacteria, and fungi observed by qPCR in benthic microbial communities
Counts and relative abundances of marker genes from total archaea, bacteria, and fungi observed by qPCR in surface water microbial communities
Metagenomic sequence data from benthic samples
DNA sequence data from ribosomal RNA marker genes from benthic samples
Metagenomic sequence data from surface water samples

dataProducts.productName: Surface water microbe marker gene sequences
dataProducts.productDescription: DNA sequence data from ribosomal RNA marker genes from surface water samples

In situ sensor-based specific conductivity, concentration of chlorophyll a, dissolved oxygen content, fDOM concentration, pH, and turbidity, available as one- or five-minute instantaneous measurements in surface water of lakes, wadeable streams, and non-wadeable streams.
Reflectance of collected sample(s) using leaf clip and hand-held field Spectrometer; opportunistic product, provided when collected.

Present summary statistics for biometeorological variables for NEON weather stations at core TIS sites. Statistics will include means, standard deviations, maxima, and minima for periods of days, months, and years. Engineering-grade product only.
Continuous measurements of stream discharge calculated from a stage-discharge rating curve and sensor-based measurements of water surface elevation.
Map showing the morphology of streams. These maps denote topography of the stream basin as well as location of the thalweg, coarse woody debris, gravel/sand bars, and other features of interest.

Bathymetry of lake bottoms and non-wadeable streams for detecting environmental change as well as for determining lake morphology, estimating primary productivity, habitat features, and water quality.

Stage discharge rating curve is generated from the relationship between staff gauge measurements and surveys of stream, river, and lake inflow/outflow discharge. It is used to calculate the L4 Continuous discharge (DP4.00130.001) data product.
Bundle of eddy-covariance data products, including related meteorological and soil data products.

Two-dimensional wind speed and direction, available as two- and thirty-minute aggregations of 1 Hz observations.  Observations are made by 2-D sonic anemometer sensors located at multiple heights on the tower infrastructure and by 2-D sonic anemometer sensors located on the aquatic meteorological station.

Air temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations. Observations are made by sensors located at multiple heights on the tower infrastructure and by sensors located on the aquatic meteorological station. Temperature observations are made using platinum resistance thermometers, which are housed in a fan aspirated shield to reduce radiative bias.

Air temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages derived from triplicate 1 Hz temperature observations. Observations are made by sensors located at the top of the tower infrastructure. Temperature observations are made by three platinum resistance thermometers, which are housed together in a fan aspirated shield to reduce radiative biases.

Barometric pressure is available as one- and thirty-minute averages for station pressure, which is determined from 0.1 Hz observations. Barometric pressure corrected to sea level and surface level (defined as water surface at aquatic sites and soil surface at terrestrial sites) is derived from station pressure averages and available at one- and thirty-minute increments. Observations are made by a single digital barometer located on the tower infrastructure and a single digital barometer located on the aquatic meteorological station.

Infrared temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  Biological temperature (i.e. surface temperature) is measured via IR temperature sensors located in the soil array and at multiple heights on the tower infrastructure.

Bulk precipitation collected using up to three methods - primary, secondary, and throughfall. Bulk precipitation is determined at five- and thirty-minute intervals for primary precipitation and at one- and thirty-minute intervals for secondary and throughfall precipitation.

Total dissolved chemical ion concentrations of sulfate (SO4 2-), nitrate (NO3-), chloride (Cl-), bromide (Br-), ammonium (NH4+), phosphate (PO4 3-), calcium (Ca2+), magnesium (Mg2+), potassium (K+), sodium (Na+), and pH/Conductivity in precipitation water; collected at TIS and AIS sites.

Total, direct beam, and diffuse shortwave radiation, available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  Observations are made by a sensor located at the top of the tower infrastructure.
Near real-time measurements of PM1.0, PM2.5, PM4, PM10, PM15 and TSP in the atmosphere using a optical sensor.

Total shortwave radiation, available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  The primary pyranometer is housed in a heated and aspirated ventilation unit and observes incoming shortwave radiation at the top of the tower infrastructure.

Net radiation is composed of incoming and outgoing shortwave and longwave radiation. These data products are available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  Observations of net shortwave and longwave radiation are made by a sensor located at the top of the tower infrastructure, while only net longwave radiation is observed in the soil array.  Observations of net shortwave and longwave radiation are made by a four-component sensor located on the aquatic meteorological station.

Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) observations represent the radiation flux at wavelengths between 400-700 nm, which constitute the wavelengths that drive photosynthesis. This data product is available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  Observations are made by sensors located at multiple heights on the tower infrastructure and by sensors located on the aquatic meteorological station.
Stable isotope ratios of 18O and 2H in precipitation water
The amount of thermal energy moving by conduction across an area of soil in a unit of time. Measured at three of the five sensor-based soil plots at each terrestrial site..

Temperature of the soil at various depth below the soil surface from 2 cm up to 200 cm at non-permafrost sites (up to 300 cm at Alaskan sites). Data are from all five Instrumented Soil Plots per site and presented as 1-minute and 30-minute averages.

The quantum line sensor provides spatially averaged observations of photosynthetically active radiation (PAR), i.e., wavelengths between 400-700 nm, at the soil surface over a one meter length. This data product is available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  Observations are obtained by sensors located throughout the soil array.

dataProducts.productName: Soil water content and water salinity
dataProducts.productDescription:
Soil volumetric water content and an index of salinity at various depths below the soil surface from 6 cm down to 200 cm at non-permafrost sites (down to 300 cm at Alaskan sites). Data are from all five Instrumented soil plots per site and presented as 1-minute and 30-minute averages.

Measurement depths are not currently being reported correctly in the sensor positions file in the Soil water content and water salinity data product (DP1.00094.001). A readme file (readme_swc_depths.txt) and an associated file containing the sensor installation depths (swc_depthsV2.csv) have been added to the data product download package until the data product algorithms are corrected.

CO2 concentration in soil air at various depth below the soil surface starting at approximately 2 cm. Data are from all five Instrumented Soil Plots per site and presented as 1-minute and 30-minute averages.

dataProducts.productName: Soil physical and chemical properties, Megapit
dataProducts.productDescription: Soil taxonomy, horizon names, horizon depths, soil bulk density, texture, and chemical properties in the <= 2 mm soil fraction for each soil horizon in each Megapit. Data were derived from a sampling location expected to be representative of the area where the Instrumented Soil Plots are located and were collected once during site construction, in collaboration with the USDA Natural Resources Conservation Service. Also see distributed soil (DP1.10086.001) and initial characterization soil (DP1.10047.001) data products, as well as the root Megapit product (DP1.10066.001) for root biomass and chemistry measurements.

Relative humidity, temperature, and dew or frost point temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations. Observations are made by sensors located at the top of the tower infrastructure, in the soil array, and on the aquatic meteorologic station.
Dust mass and density measured by a high volume dust sampler and quartz filters.
Count, distance from observer, and taxonomic identification of breeding landbirds observed during point counts
Tally and raw measurement of coarse downed wood >= 2 cm diameter

dataProducts.productName: Coarse downed wood bulk density sampling
dataProducts.productDescription: Raw bulk density measurements of coarse downed wood >= 2 cm diameter

dataProducts.productName: Digital hemispheric photos of plot vegetation
dataProducts.productDescription: Upward and/or downward facing digital 180-degree images of vegetation in plots used to calculate leaf area index
COI DNA sequences from select ground beetles

dataProducts.productName: Ground beetles sampled from pitfall traps
dataProducts.productDescription: Taxonomically identified ground beetles and the plots and times from which they were collected.
Dry weight of herbaceous vegetation harvested from individual clip strips, by functional type
Traits of sun-lit canopy plants reported at the level of the individual (woody plants) or community (herbaceous plants).

dataProducts.productName: Litterfall and fine woody debris production and chemistry
dataProducts.productDescription: Dry weight of litterfall and fine woody debris collected from elevated and ground traps, sorted to functional group, as well as periodic measurements of litter chemistry and stable isotopes.
COI DNA sequences from select mosquitoes
Presence/absence of a pathogen in a single mosquito sample (pool)
Taxonomically identified mosquitoes and the plots and times from which they were collected

dataProducts.productName: Soil physical and chemical properties, distributed initial characterization
dataProducts.productDescription: Soil physical and chemical properties measured as part of initial site characterization activities at NEON sites. Data are reported by pedogenic horizon, generally for the top 1m of the soil profile. Also see distributed periodic and Megapit soil data.
Phenophase status and intensity of tagged plants

Plant species cover-abundance and presence observed in multi-scale plots. Plant species and associated percent cover in 1m2 subplots and plant species presence in 10m2 and 100m2 subplots are reported from 400m2 plots. Archived plant vouchers and foliar tissue support the data and additional analyses.

Presence/absence of hantavirus (or antibodies to hantavirus) in each single rodent sample from 2014-2019. Beginning in 2020, the protocol was switched to detection of tick-borne diseases; these data are available in the Rodent pathogen status, tick-borne data product (DP1.10064.002).

Presence/absence of tick-borne diseases (or antibodies to same) in each single rodent sample from 2020-onward. Prior to 2020, the protocol was used to detect hantavirus; these data are available in the Rodent-borne pathogen status data product (DP1.10064.001).

Standing stock of fine and coarse root biomass plus root carbon (C) and nitrogen (N) concentrations and stable isotopes from soil Megapits. Samples were collected in 10cm increments for the first 1m depth and 20cm increments thereafter to 2m depth. Ground, oven-dried root tissues from each depth increment are available for request from the NEON Biorepository. See the soil Megapit data product (DP1.00096.001) for physical and chemical data from Megapit soils.
Fine root biomass to 30cm depth via soil core sampling. Includes root carbon (C) and nitrogen (N) concentrations and stable isotopes.
Individual- and trap-level data collected using box traps designed to capture small mammals
COI DNA sequences from select small mammals
Counts and relative abundances of archaeal, bacterial, and fungal taxa observed in soil microbial communities

dataProducts.productName: Soil physical and chemical properties, periodic
dataProducts.productDescription: Soil physical and chemical properties from the top 30 cm of the profile from periodic soil core collections. Data are reported by horizon (mineral vs. organic). See initial characterization and megapit products for additional soil data.
Presence/absence of a pathogen in each single tick sample
Abundance and density of ticks collected by drag and/or flag sampling (by species and/or lifestage)

Structure measurements of individual woody and non-woody plants, mapped positions of qualifying woody and non-woody plants, and metadata required to draw inference from individual measurements at the plot scale.
Quantitative abundance of microbes in soil samples
Metagenomic sequence data from soil samples
DNA sequence data from ribosomal RNA marker genes from soil samples
Counts and relative abundances of marker genes from total archaea, bacteria, and fungi observed by qPCR in soil microbial communities
This data product contains records of land management activities, disturbances, and other incidents of ecological note within all NEON sites

Barometric pressure, available as one-minute instantaneous measurements and thirty-minute averages for both station pressure and pressure reduced to sea level. Observations are made on the meteorology station on the buoy in lakes and rivers.
In situ sensor-based measurements of specific conductance of groundwater in wells
In situ sensor-based measurements of surface water elevation, available as five- and thirty-minute  averages in lakes, rivers, and wadeable streams. Based on sensor measurements of water pressure.

dataProducts.productName: Shortwave and longwave radiation above water on-buoy (net radiometer)
dataProducts.productDescription: Net shortwave and longwave radiation on buoys is measured twice per minute and is reported as 1-minute and 30-minute mean values.
In situ sensor-based nitrate concentration, available as fifteen minute  averages in surface water in lakes, wadeable and non-wadeable streams

dataProducts.productName: Photosynthetically active radiation at water surface
dataProducts.productDescription: Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) observations represent the radiation flux at wavelengths between 400-700 nm, which constitute the wavelengths that drive photosynthesis. This data product is available as one-, five-,  and thirty-minute averages. Observations are made at the aquatic sensor set location at lakes, non-wadeable streams, and wadeable streams.
Air temperature, available as one-minute instantaneous measurements and thirty-minute averages. Observations are made on the meteorology station on the buoy in lakes and rivers.
Discharge measurements from field-based surveys
Surface water temperature, available as one-, five-, and thirty-minute  averages, measured by a platinum resistance thermometer at the sensor location in lakes, wadeable and non-wadeable streams

dataProducts.productName: Windspeed and direction above water on-buoy
dataProducts.productDescription: Wind speed and direction; observations are made by a wind monitor consisting of a propeller and vane design on lake and river buoys.
Carbon (C) and nitrogen (N) concentrations of aquatic plant and bryophytes from benthic collections in lakes, rivers, and wadeable streams

dataProducts.productName: Aquatic plant bryophyte macroalgae clip harvest
dataProducts.productDescription: Dry weight of aquatic plant, bryophyte, and macroalgae from benthic quadrats in lakes, rivers, and wadeable streams

dataProducts.productName: Aquatic plant, bryophyte, lichen, and macroalgae point counts in wadeable streams
dataProducts.productDescription: Point counts of aquatic plants, bryophytes, lichens, and macroalgae from transects in wadeable streams
Counts and relative abundances of archaeal, bacterial, and fungal taxa observed in benthic microbial communities from wadeable streams
Grab samples of groundwater chemistry including general chemistry, anions, cations, and nutrients.
Grab samples of surface water chemistry including general chemistry, anions, cations, and nutrients.
Grab samples of surface water dissolved gases including carbon dioxide, methane, and nitrous oxide

dataProducts.productName: Groundwater and active layer measurements at permafrost sites
dataProducts.productDescription: Measurements from ground surface to liquid groundwater and active layer thaw. Collected at sites with permafrost.
Sensor based measurement of groundwater elevation calculated from pressure transducer readings in each well
COI DNA sequences from select fish in lakes and wadeable streams

dataProducts.productName: Fish electrofishing, gill netting, and fyke netting counts
dataProducts.productDescription: Counts of fish from electrofishing surveys in wadeable streams, or electrofishing, gill netting, and/or fyke netting surveys in lakes. Includes fish standard length and individual mass
Collection of benthic macroinvertebrates using multiple sampling methods in lakes, rivers, and wadeable streams
CO1 DNA sequences of the aquatic macroinvertebrate community
Cell counts from surface water microbial collection in lakes, wadeable streams, and non-wadeable streams
Counts and relative abundances of archaeal, bacterial, and fungal taxa observed in surface water microbial communities in lakes, rivers and streams

dataProducts.productName: Periphyton, seston, and phytoplankton chemical properties
dataProducts.productDescription: Carbon (C), nitrogen (N), phosphorus (P), isotopes, chlorophyll a, and pheophytin of periphyton and phytoplankton from benthic and water column samples in lakes, rivers, and wadeable streams
Collection and biomass of periphyton and phytoplankton using multiple benthic and water column sampling methods in lakes, rivers, and wadeable streams

Field and external laboratory data from the salt-tracer and gas injection field reaeration measurements, including stream widths, inert gas concentrations, conservative tracer concentrations, and conductivity times series.
Assessment of riparian vegetation percent cover in wadeable streams
Discharge measured using a constant-rate addition salt tracer during reaeration measurements
Field collection and analysis of nutrients, carbon, inorganics and physical properties in sediments of wadeable streams, rivers, and lakes
Grab samples for stable isotope chemistry including water and particulate organic matter, in lakes, rivers, and wadeable streams
In situ sensor-based measurements of groundwater temperature in each well.
Collection of zooplankton from water column samples in lakes
CO1 DNA sequences of the zooplankton community
Measurement of water column Secchi depth in non-wadeable streams and lakes
Measurements of water column temperature and depth profile in non-wadeable streams and lakes

dataProducts.productName: Photosynthetically active radiation below water surface
dataProducts.productDescription: Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) observations represent the radiation flux at wavelengths between 400-700 nm, which constitute the wavelengths that drive photosynthesis. This data product is available as one- and thirty-minute averages. Observations are made at the aquatic sensor sets at the lake inlet, lake outlet, and both lake and river buoys.

dataProducts.productName: Temperature at specific depth in surface water
dataProducts.productDescription: Sensor based measurements of water temperature in lake and river sites. Temperature is measured at specific depths by a fixed-length buoy-mounted array of temperature sensors.
Gauge height, in meters, measured at lakes, wadeable streams and non-wadeable streams.
Relative humidity, temperature, and dew or frost point temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages. Observations are made by sensors located on the buoy in lakes and rivers.
Assessment of riparian vegetation composition and physical structure in lakes, non-wadeable streams, and wadeable streams
Grab samples for stable isotopes of water in groundwater
Counts and relative abundances of marker genes from total archaea, bacteria, and fungi observed by qPCR in benthic microbial communities
Counts and relative abundances of marker genes from total archaea, bacteria, and fungi observed by qPCR in surface water microbial communities
Metagenomic sequence data from benthic samples
DNA sequence data from ribosomal RNA marker genes from benthic samples
Metagenomic sequence data from surface water samples

dataProducts.productName: Surface water microbe marker gene sequences
dataProducts.productDescription: DNA sequence data from ribosomal RNA marker genes from surface water samples

In situ sensor-based specific conductivity, concentration of chlorophyll a, dissolved oxygen content, fDOM concentration, pH, and turbidity, available as one- or five-minute instantaneous measurements in surface water of lakes, wadeable streams, and non-wadeable streams.
Outgoing pulse and slant range return waveform signals with geolocation information provided. Data are provided by flightline in the Pulsewaves format.
Unclassified three-dimensional point cloud stored in LAS format. Classifications follow ASPRS definition. All point coordinates are provided in meters. Data provided by flightline.

dataProducts.productName: Spectrometer orthorectified surface directional reflectance - flightline
dataProducts.productDescription: Surface reflectance (0-1 unitless, scaled by 10,000) computed from the NEON Imaging Spectrometer using ATCOR4r is orthorectified and output onto a fixed, uniform spatial grid using nearest-neighbor resampling. Fixed spatial grid is based on the native spatial resolution which is driven by the aircraft altitude; data are provided by flightline.

Calibrated radiance in units of uW/cm^2-sr-nm as measured by the NEON Imaging Spectrometer is orthorectified and output onto a fixed, uniform spatial grid using nearest-neighbor resampling. Fixed spatial grid is based on the native spatial resolution which is driven by the aircraft altitude; data are provided by flightline.
White balanced 8 bit RGB images orthorectified and output onto a fixed, uniform spatial grid using nearest neighbor resampling to a 10 cm spatial resolution.
Reflectance of collected sample(s) using leaf clip and hand-held field Spectrometer; opportunistic product, provided when collected.

Total amount of solar radiation in the 0.4 to 2.5 micron band reflected by the Earth surface into an upward hemisphere divided by the total amount incident from this hemisphere; data are provided by flightline

The ratio of upper leaf surface area to ground area (for broadleaf canopies), or projected conifer needle surface area to ground area (for coniferous plants) for a given unit area; measured by an industry standard (ATCOR) algorithm based on Soil Adjusted Vegetation Index (SAVI) as input; level 2 data are provided by flightline.

The fraction of incident photosynthetically active radiation (400-700 nm) absorbed by the green elements of a vegetation canopy; calculated by an industry standard (ATCOR) algorithm based on Soil Adjusted Vegetation Index (SAVI) as input; data are provided by flightline at equivalent resolution to spectrometer orthorectified surface directional reflectance, carbon and nutrient cycling due to its relationship with vegetative productivity.
Normalized index of canopy water content; data are provided by flightline

NDVI - Normalized ratio of NIR and IR bands; characterizes the "red edge" in vegetation spectra. SAVI - Normalized ratio of 850 nm and 650 nm bands with gain and offset factors to minimize soil contribution in result; primary input to LAI product. EVI - Normalized ratio of NIR and IR bans (red edge characterization); includes Blue channel for better aerosol characterization. Data are provided by flightline; additional indices will be assessed and added to this product

dataProducts.productName: Spectrometer orthorectified surface directional reflectance - mosaic
dataProducts.productDescription: Orthorectified Surface reflectance (0-1 unitless, scaled by 10,000) computed from the NEON Imaging Spectrometer (NIS) per pixel; data are orthorectified and output onto a fixed, uniform spatial grid using nearest-neighbor resampling (tbr). Level 1 flight lines over a given site are mosaicked into 1 km by 1 km tiles with a spatial resolution of 1m.

Level 1 high-resolution orthorectified camera images are mosaiced and tiled into 1 km by 1 km data sets. Mosiac is output onto a fixed, uniform spatial grid using nearest-neighbor resampling; spatial resolution is at least 0.1 m.
Total amount of solar radiation in the 0.4 to 2.5 micron band reflected by the Earth’s surface into an upward hemisphere divided by the total amount incident from this hemisphere

The ratio of upper leaf surface area to ground area (for broadleaf canopies), or projected conifer needle surface area to ground area (for coniferous plants) for a given unit area; measured by an industry standard (ATCOR) algorithm based on Soil Adjusted Vegetation Index (SAVI) as input; level 3 data are provided as 1 km by 1 km mosaic tiles.

The fraction of incident photosynthetically active radiation (400-700 nm) absorbed by the green elements of a vegetation canopy; mosaiced from the fPAR level 2 product onto a spatially uniform grid at 1 m spatial resolution and provided as 1 km by 1 km tiles.

Height of the top of canopy above bare earth (Canopy Height Model (CHM));  data are mosaicked over AOP footprint; mosaicked onto a spatially uniform grid at 1 m spatial resolution in 1 km by 1 km tiles.
Normalized index of canopy water content. Level 2 products derived from individual flight lines over a given site are mosaicked into single product; spatial resolution is 1m.

All features and bare earth elevation given in meters in the NAVD88 (Geoid12A realization) reference frame as a DSM and DTM respectively. Bare earth is created by classifying and removing vegetation and man-made structures. Both the DSM and DTM are mosaicked onto a spatially uniform grid at 1 m spatial resolution in 1 km by 1 km tiles.

Slope is a ratio of rise over run (height over distance) of the bare earth elevation product given in degrees; aspect is the direction of the steepest slope of the bare earth elevation product (e.g., north, east, south, west) given in degrees clockwise from grid north; both mosaicked onto a spatially uniform grid at 1 m spatial resolution in 1 km by 1 km tiles.

NDVI - Normalized ratio of NIR and IR bands; characterizes the "red edge" in vegetation spectra. SAVI - Normalized ratio of 850 nm and 650 nm bands with gain and offset factors to minimize soil contribution in result; primary input to LAI product. EVI - Normalized ratio of NIR and IR bans (red edge characterization); includes Blue channel for better aerosol characterization.  Level 2 products derived from individual flight lines over a given site are mosaicked into single product; spatial resolution is 1m.

Present summary statistics for biometeorological variables for NEON weather stations at core TIS sites. Statistics will include means, standard deviations, maxima, and minima for periods of days, months, and years. Engineering-grade product only.
Continuous measurements of stream discharge calculated from a stage-discharge rating curve and sensor-based measurements of water surface elevation.
Map showing the morphology of streams. These maps denote topography of the stream basin as well as location of the thalweg, coarse woody debris, gravel/sand bars, and other features of interest.

Bathymetry of lake bottoms and non-wadeable streams for detecting environmental change as well as for determining lake morphology, estimating primary productivity, habitat features, and water quality.

Stage discharge rating curve is generated from the relationship between staff gauge measurements and surveys of stream, river, and lake inflow/outflow discharge. It is used to calculate the L4 Continuous discharge (DP4.00130.001) data product.
Bundle of eddy-covariance data products, including related meteorological and soil data products.
